intro: Gamwellia, commonly known as the common gamewell, is a perennial flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branching stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly rough texture. Gamwellia is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
